net.sf.mmm.util.search.base

Class AbstractSearchCriteria

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.transferobject.api.AbstractTransferObject
      • net.sf.mmm.util.search.base.AbstractSearchCriteria
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Entity, SearchCriteria, TransferObject

    public abstract class AbstractSearchCriteria
extends AbstractTransferObject
implements SearchCriteria
    This is the abstract base implementation of SearchCriteria.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:

        public boolean equals(Object obj)

      • getMaximumHitCount

        public Integer getMaximumHitCount()
        Description copied from interface: SearchCriteria
        This method gets the maximum number of hits that will be received as result for this query.
        Note:
        This feature is the same as Query.setMaxResults(int) in JPA.
        Specified by:
        getMaximumHitCount in interface SearchCriteria
        Returns:
        the maximum hit-count or null for NO limit.

      • getHitOffset

        public int getHitOffset()
        Description copied from interface: SearchCriteria
        This method gets the offset for the first hit. This is 0 by default. By providing a multiple of SearchCriteria.getMaximumHitCount() you can simply implement paging.
        Note:
        This feature is the same as Query.setFirstResult(int) in JPA.
        Specified by:
        getHitOffset in interface SearchCriteria
        Returns:
        the offset of the first hit.

      • getSearchTimeout

        public Long getSearchTimeout()
        Description copied from interface: SearchCriteria
        This method gets the maximum delay in milliseconds the search may last until it is canceled.
        Note:
        This feature is the same as the query hint "javax.persistence.query.timeout" in JPA.
        Specified by:
        getSearchTimeout in interface SearchCriteria
        Returns:
        the search timeout in milliseconds or null for NO timeout.

      • setMaximumHitCount

        public void setMaximumHitCount(Integer maximumHitCount)

        public void setHitOffset(int hitOffset)

      • setSearchTimeout

        public void setSearchTimeout(Long searchTimeout)
        Parameters:
        searchTimeout - is the new value of getSearchTimeout().

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Description copied from interface: SearchCriteria
        This method determines if the search should be performed in read-only mode. In such case the result hits can NOT be modified or their changes will NOT be persisted. If a search-engine does not support this feature (e.g. for full-text search this makes no sense), it will be ignored.
        Specified by:
        isReadOnly in interface SearchCriteria
        Returns:
        true if read-only, false otherwise (default).

      • setReadOnly

        public void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
        Parameters:
        readOnly - is the new value of isReadOnly().

      • limitMaximumHitCount

        public void limitMaximumHitCount(int limit)
        Limits the maximum hit count by the given limit. If current maximum hit count is null or greater than the given limit, the value is replaced by limit.
        Parameters:
        limit - is the maximum allowed value for maximum hit count.
        Since:
        6.0.0
